etymology.description: 來(來) (lái, "come") + 麥(麥) (mài, "wheat") = coming of wheat -> wheat
etymology.interpretation: The character 麳(lái) combines elements representing 'coming' and 'wheat' to signify the arrival or production of wheat, illustrating its fundamental meaning related to wheat.

examples.chinese: 秋天到了(秋天到了)，麳变成金黄(麳變成金黃)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān dào le, lái biànchéng jīn huáng.
examples.english: When autumn arrives, the wheat turns golden.

examples.chinese: 农民辛苦劳作(農民辛苦勞作)，等待成熟的麳(等待成熟的麳)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngmín xīnkǔ láozuò, děngdài chéngshú de lái.
examples.english: The farmers work hard, waiting for the wheat to mature.

examples.chinese: 在市场上(在市場上)，新收割的麳吸引了顾客(新收割的麳吸引了顧客)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shìchǎng shàng, xīn shōugē de lái xīyǐn le gùkè.
examples.english: At the market, the freshly harvested wheat attracted customers.
